device.label: Hello World!
device.description:
This device driver serves as a starting point to learn about the structure of device drivers in the Dia as well as to be used as a template in order to create new drivers.
The hello_world device is a virtual device driver. It connects to no hardware peripheral. The driver is comprised of the following two features:
\t- A greeting string ("Hello ") which can never be changed, only sampled. \t- A suffix string ("World!") which can be changed by the user to illustrated the concept of setting a driver component.

setting.label: Prefix init
setting.tooltip: Greeting string which can never be changed when Dia is running, only sampled.

setting.label: Suffix init
setting.tooltip: Suffix string that will be stored in 'suffix_string' channel. This value can be changed by the user when Dia is running.

setting.label: Update rate
setting.tooltip: Defines how fast the final string will be composed (by the prefix and suffix) inside the 'xtended_string' channel, in seconds.
